sentence.Network_en: The seeds of dandelion were carried to the meadow by the wind.
sentence.Network_cn: 风把蒲公英的种子吹到草地上.

sentence.Network_en: While herbalists make dandelion into tincture, the leaves can be eaten raw in salad or steamed with the flowers and eaten like vegetables.
sentence.Network_cn: 草药专家把蒲公英制成药剂, 而它的叶子可以拌入生菜沙拉中生吃或与花一起煮了当蔬菜吃.

sentence.Network_en: The Dandelion Patch is the least developed of the four active vents.
sentence.Network_cn: “蒲公英区”在这四个活裂口中是发育最差的一个.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from French dent-de-lion, translation of medieval Latin dens leonis 'lion's tooth' (because of the jagged shape of the leaves)

entry.def: A dandelion is a wild plant which has yellow flowers with lots of thin petals. When the petals of each flower drop off, a fluffy white ball of seeds grows.

means.word_mean: 1. any of several herbs of the genus Taraxacum having long tap roots and deeply notched leaves and bright yellow flowers followed by fluffy seed balls
